attributes.action: Stop work on HS2 immediately and hold a new vote to repeal the legislation
attributes.background: We ask Parliament to repeal the High Speed Rail Bills, 2016 and 2019, as MPs voted on misleading environmental, financial and timetable information provided by the Dept. of Transport and HS2 Ltd. It fails to address the conditions of the Paris Accord as costs have risen from £56bn to over £100bn.
attributes.additional_details: Our environment and economy are in peril. HS2 is destroying nature and inflicting suffering on businesses and property owners. Government is investing in an inept and recklessly run project, offering poor value for money. HS2 will not reach Net Zero by 2050 nor help us level up the North. The pandemic has changed how we work forever and invalidated the business case. Given the climate emergencies we face, and now the economic and pandemic crises - Parliament must vote to repeal the legislation.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/314520

attributes.action: Introduce Funding for PV for Schools, Public buildings and new build houses.
attributes.background: I would like parliament to discuss and work out a way to create a scheme/regulations to help the general public add PV panels and EV chargers to their houses. This includes other means of renewables; however solar is now widely available to the public. Public buildings should also be converted.
attributes.additional_details: We have learnt a lot about the world in the past century, and one major part of this learning curve is that we have been destroying the planet with GHG, This needs to stop. And although MP’s may say they are onboard with the 2050 goal of net zero; It seems very unlikely to happen at this particular moment. This needs to change.  Funding must be poured into the renewable market. This will soon be a factor of making or breaking political parties. They need to act now.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see increased support for renewable energy and electric vehicles, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. It's not clear if you want the Government to provide funding for specific technologies, or all renewable technologies, and it would need to be clearer from the title of your petition what action you want the Government to take.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Fund free solar panels for all homes: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/588314

Provide funding for English schools to install solar panels: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/588472

attributes.action: Stop the Whitehaven Coal Mine project
attributes.background: This proposal is a complete backwards step of the “green new deal”. If this coal mine goes ahead, it will wreck havoc on the climate. The government must stick to their promises. We are supposed to be “leading the way” to net-zero and set a good example. This is an embarrassment for Britain.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/568475

attributes.action: We demand that Rishi Sunak goes to COP 27. The UK has to lead climate action.
attributes.background:
COP26 focused on the ‘what’ and COP27 focuses on the ‘how’. The UK needs to be part of COP to shape the vision into concrete commitments, policies and actions.
UK is off track to ensure a stable future for people, our environment and economies. Not attending shows a lack of leadership and priority.
attributes.additional_details:
During COP26 the UK demonstrated strong climate leadership by negotiating to increase country climate commitments, supporting a shift from 30% to 90% of the global economy being covered by net-zero targets. 
The UK is not quite on track to meet its 2030 climate targets. A report from the UN warns global average temperature rises may be on course for above 2°C even if climate targets are reached, so all governments, including the UK, will need to do much more by 2030 to catalyse action.

rejection.details: We can't accept petitions which call for actions with regard to named individuals, including the Prime Minister, but since you started your petition it has been confirmed that Rishi Sunak will attend COP27.

attributes.action: Referendum on Net Zero Target and the Green Agenda
attributes.background: We need to start hearing opinions on the other side of Climate Change, we should have a Vote on the whole thing to see if the public even supports the Actions of our Government on Climate Change once they have heard the real evidence and the Cost / Benefit analysis.
attributes.additional_details: We need to take action now to avoid wrecking our way of life before it go's too far and irreversible.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599602

If you wanted to start a petition requesting something different, you'd need to provide your full name.

attributes.action: Fast track policy implementation to meet net zero by 2050.
attributes.background:
The UK is a long way off track to meet its 2050 net zero carbon target and as the COP26 host, it is vitally important that our own house is in order. 
Fast tracking policy implementation and publishing promised decarbonisation strategies should be the government’s immediate focus.
attributes.additional_details:
Decisive action now will be cheaper than the high economic costs of climate breakdown and will help to protect those on the lowest incomes from adverse impacts. 
Rapid decarbonisation will also benefit society through improved health and wellbeing, and job creation in new emerging industries. 
Ensuring the costs and benefits of this transition are fairly distributed will require strong leadership from government. 
https://green-alliance.org.uk/resources/Net_zero_policy_tracker_September_2021.pdf

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do to fast track policy implementation, such as which policies you'd like to be implemented. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Subsidise electric cars so that they become affordable and practical to use
attributes.background: Subsidise the production of electric road vehicles so they become as affordable as petrol-fuelled vehicles. Increase the number of electric car charging stations and invest in new battery technology so that the vehicles are practical to use.
attributes.additional_details:
Transport is a major source of greenhouse gas emissions in the UK. If we are to stand a chance against climate change, we need to cut greenhouse gas emissions to net-zero by 2025. 

At the moment, the demand for electric cars is low because they are impractical and unaffordable. Individuals will always make decisions that provide them with the highest amount of personal utility. It is the responsibility of the government to make sustainable choices within our interest.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

There is already a grant available for electric vehicles. You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/plug-in-car-van-grants
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: build more cycling lanes around Derbyshire and promote more cycling safety.
attributes.background: I would like the government to fund the construction of new cycling lanes in Derbyshire. In addition, I would like them to fund advertisement to promote cycling safety and cycling in general.
attributes.additional_details: Firstly, cycling lanes create a more safe environment for cyclists. This will encourage more people to cycle rather than drive which is beneficial for peoples health and the environment. Furthermore, it will benefit the governments publicity by getting closer to the net zero goal. Finally, the cycling lanes and safety encouragement will prevent cyclists from getting injured which is significant because of the popularity of cycling around the High Peak/Derbyshire

rejection.details:
You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Incentivise Landlord to Invest in Green Energy for Their Properties
attributes.background: Provide an incentive to encourage as many UK landlords to move away from the use of fossil fuels, with small incentives to use energy companies who only use renewable energy sources and larger incentives to install solar panels. Further measures could include incentivising electric boilers.
attributes.additional_details: The Climate Crisis is a highly important subject, and while many in the UK do not have the means to make a significant impact. This would help in a significant way towards eliminating fossil fuels from energy production in the UK with how many rented properties there are in the UK. There is need for our government to take real action, and this is just one of many measures that will help to take a step in the right direction towards the 'net-zero' goal.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

We understand you're concerned about climate change and the role of improvements to rented properties in tackling this, but we're not sure what specific incentives you want to be put in place to encourage landlords to make such improvements.

You could start a new petition explaining specifically what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Release all data regarding E10 fuel and it's help to reach CO2 net zero .
attributes.background:
Using more E10 that E5 negates lower CO2  
Emmisions and actually increases carbon emitted from exausts
attributes.additional_details: I used 3tanks of E10 an a journey that would use just less than 2tanks of E5

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the transition to E10 fuel, but we're not sure exactly what data you'd like the Government to release.

You can find a number of Government publications on the move to E10 fuel here (including a consultation document and an associated impact assessment): https://www.gov.uk/government/consultations/introducing-e10-petrol

attributes.action: COVID-19 economic rescue plans must be green
attributes.background:
Coronavirus and climate change are the biggest challenges facing a generation.

Emergency financing must be used to build a sustainable economy which supports our health and wellbeing and drives growth, providing new jobs and opportunities across the UK for our generation and those of the future.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2019, Parliament declared a climate change emergency. 

The government committed to net-zero carbon emissions by 2050, pledging investment in clean energy solutions and green infrastructure and forecasting that the low carbon economy ‘could grow 11 per cent per year between 2015 and 2030, four times faster than the projected growth of the economy as a whole’.

The government must invest emergency funds in green and reproductive sectors including health, social care and public services.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/

attributes.action: Make permanent positive environmental benefits arising from Covid 19 measures.
attributes.background:
The Government has taken radical action in response to Coronavirus. This has led to short term reductions in emissions and improvements in air quality.

When it becomes possible to lift the 'lockdown', the Government should consider as its greatest priority how to make these benefits permanent.
attributes.additional_details:
It would truly be a tragedy if, after so many people working so hard to tackle Covid 19, the UK did not act as the scientific consensus tells us we must act, to tackle the ongoing Climate Emergency.

We need to reach net zero carbon before the Government's 2050 target. If we act to make permanent reductions which would otherwise be temporary, there is a chance to achieve this much sooner, avoiding or mitigating future climate breakdown, and, indeed, saving lives.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We understand that you want the Government to reach its net zero carbon target before 2050, however we're not exactly sure what you mean by "make permanent positive environmental benefits".

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

We've published a number of petitions asking for the Government or Parliament to take action on this issue which you may like to sign: 

Support carbon neutral energy alternatives:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300000

Run a Public Awareness Campaign about the Climate and Ecological Emergency:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301289

Study the impact of home working on the environment and act on the results: 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317466

Ban commercial flights on Sundays: 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308349

Ban unnecessary travel to work: 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319793

attributes.action: DO NOT delay ANY carbon-reduction commitments on the journey to Net Zero 2050
attributes.background: Delivering Net Zero CARBON EMISSIONS by 2050 is a tough target. Notwithstanding all other pressures, this is the highest priority for our Nation's wellbeing and prosperity. Pressing actions must be taken NOW and continue WITH URGENCY throughout 2022-2050 to comply with the Environment Law (Nov 2021)
attributes.additional_details:
Less than 0.2% of the electorate voted for Liz Truss as PM. We DO NOT TRUST her pledge to 'ensure opportunity and prosperity for all people and future generations' as she diverts wildly from the commitments that elected this government into office.
Specifically, any redirection of post-CAP Land Management Scheme (ELMS) financing, designated to consolidate a long-term vision to revitalise natural resources, our land base and our agronomy will be welcoming climate change catastrophy. What a legacy

rejection.details:
We understand you would like to see the Government fulfil it's commitments to the 2050 net zero target for carbon emissions and not delay, but the target is set out in law and the Government have not outlined any changes or delay to that year as the target.

You could start a new petition which explains clearly which specific actions you would like the Government to take to achieve the 2050 target.

We currently have the below petition open on a similar theme, which you might like to sign:

Bring forward the Net Zero emissions target to 2030
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616392

attributes.action: Scrap ALL 'plans' for the UK to reach Net Zero
attributes.background: Plans for net zero are crippling the UK. The current cost of living crisis has been brough to the fore by the Governments plans to reach this unreachable goal without any forethought of the impending consequences. Stop this now!
attributes.additional_details: All aspects of the net zero agenda are damaging to the UK, its businesses (across all sectors including hospitality and farming), its health service, its schools, its children and its citizens. The push towards this goal will see 1000s of businesses fail resulting in mass unemployment which will push the UKs citizens to the brink, our health service will suffer leaving 1000s on longer waiting lists. Nothing good will come from this continued push, only devastation.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We're not sure what you mean by 'plans' and what specific actions you'd like to be scrapped.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Net Zero: Government to reconsider the current approach to achieving the goal.
attributes.background: We should continue to use our own supplies of gas, coal and oil until suitable, efficient alternatives are found. Alternatives should be researched for supplying new builds.  Heat pump installations should be used only when suitable, not when impractical and costly.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst we need to reduce our emissions, we are taking a hypocritical route by using fossil fuels that are not our own. We are increasing the cost and increasing the emissions by using sea and road transport to move the fuels, especially coal. 

Replacing central heating systems and building wind farms might help towards reducing our emissions, but production of these items causes more emissions than we are saving. We should take into account that many of the redundant items cannot be recycled.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about the Government's current approach to achieving Net Zero, but it's not clear if you want the Government to change its targets for achieving Net Zero, or just amend certain policies regarding domestic fossil fuel production and wind power, and incentives for heat pumps.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Government to review reform claim of 100% renewable energy sale to consumers.
attributes.background: Call on Government to review and reform the current wholesale electricity market, to increase transparency on energy companies claiming their energy is 100% renewable source when over 50% of the energy being produced is clearly hedged against fossil fuels.
attributes.additional_details:
Consumer spending needs to be a major consideration in the shift to a net zero carbon future. Over 70% of people believe that what they do, how they live and what they buy can have an affect on carbon reduction.

Subscribing to a 100% renewable energy tarriff the consumer expects that energy from a 100% renewable source. Thus increasing the pot of funding in renewable energy infrastructure such as wind, solar, geothermal, green hydrogen and reducing the energy from fossil fuels long term.

rejection.details:
In September 2021, the Government announced that the Competition and Markets Authority will carry out a full review of misleading green claims, both on and offline, at the start of 2022. 

During that period, the Government published a "Green Claims Code" to help businesses comply with the law in any claims about their environmental impact. 

You can find out about the CMA review and the Green Claims Code here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/greenwashing-cma-puts-businesses-on-notice

attributes.action: Net Zero. PM to hold a full independent enquiry focusing on economic outcomes.
attributes.background:
Whilst there appears to be a change to the world climate, we in the UK are one of the smallest contributors to emissions.

We are in danger of bankrupting our country, while the larger nations, China and India, continue as they are, causing pollution, which makes our efforts pointless.
attributes.additional_details:
In ceasing to use our own coal and gas, we are importing inferior coal and gas from other countries. This is imported using ships and road transport. This of course, is increasing the very footprint that we are claiming to reduce. While we grow poorer by doing this, other countries continue to pollute and become richer.
We should continue to use our own fuels and explore the possibilities of alternatives, such as building smaller power plants, such as suggested by James Dyson. We can then navigate our way to reducing emissions in a sensible way.

Insisting that we all throw away our efficient gas boilers is not the answer.

We would like an urgent enquiry taking all aspects into account, followed by a debate in parliament and, if necessary, a referendum.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We're not sure if you want an inquiry on the "economic outcomes" of Net Zero or "all aspects"

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, or you might like to sign this petition

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599602

attributes.action: Bring the date for the net-zero target closer.
attributes.background: Make the net-zero target date closer so that we can foresee that period of time more easily. We have no idea what will happen in 29 years and this is a target where we can't say exactly what that time will be like. I want parliament to take action, to restore our planet for now and for the future.
attributes.additional_details: In a recent live chat during the COP26 event, we were informed that climate change is like a boulder, when it reaches that top of the hill it'll roll by itself all the way down the other side and we won't be able to stop it. This means that damage will be caused uncontrollably, without us being able to make a difference. We don't know where this boulder is, if it is on the edge, we need to act now, we don't know whether it is here or not, therefore, we need to act as soon as it is possible.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the current target for reducing the UK's carbon emissions to zero, but it's not clear how much you want this to be brought forward by.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government to change this target to, or we could accept a petition calling on the Government to review the current net zero target date.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to seek public authorisation for  Net-Zero Climate Policies.
attributes.background: In order to ensure the broadest possible consent for widespread & far reaching climate policies a referendum be held where everyone over the age of 16 should be eligible and there would need to be a two thirds majority of the electorate ( not turnout ) to authorise the pursuit of Net Zero policies.
attributes.additional_details:
The stated policies to date are  uncosted & unpublished by H M Government and reliant on information and statements from political rather than scientific bases. The “science” on climate change is not settled as is borne out by several hundred, peer reviewed, scientific papers published over the last five years. 
Unless the public are made aware of the immediate and long term effects of Net-Zero, the political and societal repercussions could result in widespread unrest throughout the UK.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

The Government hasn't yet published its net zero strategy or set out exactly what policies it will pursue in order to reach its net zero target, so we're not sure exactly which policies you'd like to see considered in a referendum.

You could start a new petition calling for a referendum on the principle of the UK pursuing policies in order to achieve net zero carbon emissions, if that's something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Make visible colour-coded carbon footprint labels compulsory on all food items
attributes.background: To diminish carbon emissions and to stop the climate crisis, we need to raise awareness of the carbon footprint of everyday food items. This will not only help consumers make informed decisions about purchases, but will also incentivise large brands and supermarkets to reach carbon neutrality.
attributes.additional_details: Action on all levels is needed to combat the climate crisis; from consumers to multinational companies. The public need readily available, highly visible and understandable information regarding the carbon footprint of food products. Stickers detailing this, with colour codes depending on proximity to carbon net zero, similar to the nutritional 'traffic light' symbols, should be compulsory. This will also give companies an incentive to lower the carbon footprint of their products.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549594

attributes.action: E-Scooters/E-Bikes should be legal to use on public roads and public areas.
attributes.background:
The law should be changed to allow public use of E-Scooters. They should be used by 16 years and over and should be classed as a motored vehicle. Allowing for insurance and use on public areas.

As current law stands E-Scooters and bikes can only be used on private land!
attributes.additional_details:
E-scooters and bikes are an up and coming mode of transport. Changing the law around them will increase use. The Benifit is clean energy and a safe mode of transport. The government promised a carbon neutral country. This included reducing the amount of carbon emitting cars to net zero. But this does not include a change for under 18s.
The use of petrol scooters by under 18s are in huge use today. But with no alternative use how can we ask for a carbon neutral county with no alternative for under 18s?

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Legalize Personal Light Electric vehicles (PLEVs) such as e-scooters, EUC, etc.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332067

Legalise and regulate the use of privately owned eScooters before Spring 2021.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553756

attributes.action: Create a law to make UK private pensions be invested in sustainable companies.
attributes.background:
Make a law to ensure that private pensions are invested in sustainable and ecologically sound companies by default. 

With members of pensions having the option to opt out of sustainable investment rather than opt in. 

A similar method to the organ donor list.
attributes.additional_details:
By doing this, it will move billions of pounds of investment into companies that meet sustainable targets set by the government. As investment is than moved away from the unsustainable companies it will force them to increase their awareness and make the move to net zero. 

Pensions are big money and creating a law to move all pension investments this way by default will make the UK meet its long term strategic environmental goals by making companies think about their business activities.

rejection.details: Decisions about investments by private pension funds are a matter for fund managers, not the Government or House of Commons.

attributes.action: Implement a green recovery package
attributes.background:
Invest in:
-Clean transportation
-Renewable energy 
-Retrofit buildings to improve their energy efficiency
-Reduce waste and improve recycling
-Protect nature and wildlife and restore degraded habitats.
attributes.additional_details:
This is essential as the recovery package can either bring us closer or further away from our zero-net emissions target. It can secure our and our children's wellbeing. It can build a competitive Britain in renewable energy and transportation or see us fall behind other nations.
The Committee on Climate Change illustrated that spending on low-carbon activities would provide a bigger boost to the economy, in both the short and long term, than pursuing a traditional recovery.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

attributes.action: Stop plans for a new coal mine in Cumbria
attributes.background: A debate should be had in parliament about the environmental impact of a new coal mine in Cumbria. This petition and others should be used as evidence that the public do not support this new mine.
attributes.additional_details: Coal mining damages the climate and moves Britain further from its net zero target. It reduces our ability to lobby other countries to mitigate the effects of climate change.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/629570

attributes.action: Start drilling again for our natural resources
attributes.background: We should be self sufficient in oil and gas instead of going for net zero in a unrealistic time.
attributes.additional_details: People are now in fuel poverty when we are sitting on natural resources that could provide this country for generations. Drill for it but keep it in this country.

rejection.details: The Government has confirmed it will continue to issue licenses for gas and oil exploration.

attributes.action: Stop the ULEZ expansion to Greater London in August 2023
attributes.background: Government need to at a minimum delay the ULEZ coming to Greater London for a few years. The majority of these people cannot afford to replace their cars if they are not compliant. Having seen an increase in the cost of living, energy and fuel amongst other things, & our wages not reflecting this.
attributes.additional_details: Since COVID the economy has taken a hit, which the taxpayers are paying for. I also appreciate we have a duty to be net zero by 2050. A year to replace 1000's of cars that are not compliant, the manufacturers already have waiting lists for new cars so they can't meet the demand. There is a shortage in second-hand cars. £12.50 per day to drive is extortionate, the unemployment rate will rise as people can't afford to get to work. People don't have the finances to accommodate all these increases.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. It is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Revoke local government powers to charge CAZ, LEZ, ZEZ and ULEZ: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/618266

attributes.action: More money invested into renewable energy sources
attributes.background: As a part of the 2008 Climate Change Act, the government must invest more money into renewable energy sources.
attributes.additional_details: The government isn’t putting enough money into their schemes. Included in the 2008 act is a pledge to reach net zero by 2050. This will simply not happen if the government doesn’t invest more money into increasing renewable energy sources, and support scientists in discovering how we can make these sources more efficient. This is why we are demanding significantly increased funding and investment, so that we can save our planet before it's too late.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617729

attributes.action: End net zero and green levies on our energy bills.
attributes.background: Net zero is being paid for by inflating our gas and electricity bills. Wind turbines are NOT FREE. We are all paying for them. We the tax paying people were never asked if we wanted to go green.
attributes.additional_details:
We want the government to reduce our energy bills instead of throwing millions into fuel poverty by paying for expensive unreliable energy. When the wind doesn't blow and the sun has gone down renewable energy is useless. The energy we use should be reliable and cheap. Our energy should come from North Sea gas and oil and be refined here in the UK.
We also need to increase our capacity for refining gas and oil.
The transition to green energy should be natural as it gets cheaper in the future.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the cost of decarbonising the UK's electricity supply, but it's not clear exactly what changes you want the Government to make to current policy. It's not clear if you want the Government to abandon all policies to reduce carbon emissions in the UK, or just green levies on fuel.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Suspend the green levies on domestic fuel immediately: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607977

attributes.action: The UK government needs to create a ministerial post of carbon chancellor.
attributes.background: To meet ambitious climate targets, it is essential that the government now creates a substantive post of carbon chancellor. Such a position is essential to achieving a year on year reduction in UK emissions. As with finance, an annual budget would be set and achieved with proper policy measures.
attributes.additional_details: To achieve a 78% reduction in UK emissions by 2035, still more net zero by 2050, requires the government to take immediate and drastic action to meet these ambitious targets. This will never happen without a new minister of state who has this specific responsibility. It is no longer acceptable to pledge changes without indicating how these can be met in an agreed and overt way. The climate emergency is still with us, and requires just as much focus as the pandemic and war in Ukraine.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the priority the Government has given climate targets, but there's already a Minister for Energy, Clean Growth and Climate Change, who is responsible for the UK's Net Zero Strategy, carbon budgets, and various other matters: https://www.gov.uk/government/ministers/minister-of-state--75

It's not clear what differences you want the ministerial post you propose to have from this current role.

attributes.action: Remove green levy’s from household bills and rely on private investment.
attributes.background:
Remove green levy’s from household bills, there is enough market interest in sustainability, and the environment to maximise the opportunity through the private sector.
Allow the private sector to fund and drive forward net zero and increase renewable energy sources
attributes.additional_details: To release the tax/bill payer from the the cost of investing without a return, others are profit making on the tax/bill payers mandatory payments.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607977

attributes.action: Organisations claiming commitment to net zero Carbon must have audited plans
attributes.background: Any large organisation, public or private, (ie >250 employees, >£36m annual turnover or annual balance sheet >£18m) that makes a claim of a commitment to achieve net zero carbon must provide a delivery plan that has been independently audited against the SBTI or equivalent independent standard
attributes.additional_details: Many organisations, both public and private sector, are now claiming a commitment to reach net zero carbon by a set date. This commitment needs to be backed by a robust plan to have any validity. To prevent greenwashing, organisations must demonstrate how they plan to achieve net zero carbon. This plan must be independently checked against a robust and recognised standard. The SBTI standard (https://sciencebasedtargets.org/net-zero) has been created specifically for this purpose.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about whether to make a commitment to achieving net zero, and plans to achieve this, are a matter for individual businesses, not the Government or Parliament.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to require all businesses to publish net zero plans, setting out how their businesses plan to respond to the Government's commitments to reduce carbon emissions.

attributes.action: Ban the mining of and trade in "proof of work" cryptocurrencies.
attributes.background: Bitcoin, Ethereum and Dogecoin are all popular cryptocurrencies which use proof of work to secure transactions. Proof of work is incredibly wasteful: current estimates suggest that it currently uses around 0.5% of the world's electricity. We cannot afford this waste if we want to reach net zero.
attributes.additional_details:
The computers used to mine Bitcoin are specialised, can't be repurposed and rapidly become obsolete. This generates a lot of electronic waste. Recent estimates have concluded that mining operations consume 4% of specialised semiconductor manufacturing and 20% of all graphics card sales. 

A ban on proof of work based cryptocurrencies, would not be a full ban on cryptocurrencies but would instead incentivise them to move to more environmentally friendly mining algorithms such as proof of stake.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

The Government is not responsible for whether individuals or businesses choose to mine for cryptocurrency. This is a matter for individuals or businesses to decide.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to prohibit transactions in cryptocurrencies in the UK, as this is something the Government is responsible for.

attributes.action: Ban the use and sale of all fireworks in the UK including organised displays.
attributes.background: Ban the use and sale of all fireworks and pyrotechnic displays in the United Kingdom as they disturb wildlife, produce waste and harm the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Around bonfire night, there is a noticeable increase in air pollution and decrease in air quality. This is from particulate matter and dioxins. Approximately 5-10% of all of the UKs dioxin emissions are on this night alone. As gunpowder is the main component, sulphur and metal oxides are emitted as well. 

If the uk is serious about becoming net zero then fireworks must go to meet these targets as well as to remove the litter they cause as well as disruptions and upset to wildlife.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599738

attributes.action: Open debate on Boris Johnson's proposed Net Zero costing taxpayers trillions.
attributes.background: Current proposed plans by this Government are not democratic nor with consent. People need to know both sides of the argument before agreeing to ANY steps which will cost them trillions as well as change their lives. Government bases its conclusions on some scientists 'models' & 'predictions'.
attributes.additional_details: There has never been a debate about any Climate Change issue & therefore we call upon Government to arrange its advisors/organisations to meet in TV public debate, with scientists/organisations that oppose climate emergency/change so that the People are fully aware of both sides of the argument & have the opportunity to discuss in more detail. Only then, can you ask the People for their Consent to spending of trillions of taxpayers money on any "Net Zero" plan by way of vote.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about holding televised public debates are a matter for broadcasters, not the Government or Parliament.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Hold a referendum on whether to keep the 2050 net zero target: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599602

attributes.action: Enact a transformative Green New Deal for the UK
attributes.background: Bouncing back to black fossil fuels is not an option. Burning fossil fuels is the main cause of air pollution (DEFRA). Tragically, air pollution kills 40,000 people in the UK every year (Royal College of Physicians and the Royal College of Paediatrics and Child Health, 2016). This must stop.
attributes.additional_details:
A transformative Green New Deal is the answer. An ambitious plan that will secure a safe climate and fairer society by totally transforming our economy (Green New Deal UK, 2019).

The Green New Deal must put the UK on a net zero greenhouse gas emissions trajectory to limit global heating to 1.5 degrees. It must also be built on the principles of social, economic and environmental justice. 

It is time for a green recovery where the health and wellbeing of all people and the planet are put first.

rejection.details:
